newsitem.title: SWEDEN: SWIMMING-THOMPSON WINS WOMEN'S 100 FREESTYLE WORLD TITLE.
newsitem.headline: SWIMMING-THOMPSON WINS WOMEN'S 100 FREESTYLE WORLD TITLE.

text.p: Jenny Thompson deposed China's Le Jingyi and brought the United States their first title of the world short-course championships in the women's 100 metres freestyle on Thursday.
Thompson came through in the second half of the race after Germany's Sandra Voelker had set a sizzling pace over the first two lengths of the 25-metre pool.
Voelker, the European short-course champion and silver medallist behind Le at the 1996 Atlanta Olympics, went through the 50-metre mark in 25.23 seconds, inside Le's world record schedule.
But she could not quite sustain the pace and Thompson, a relay gold medallist at the last two Olympics, surged through to win by just 0.04 seconds.
Thompson, 100 freestyle silver medallist at the 1992 Olympics, clocked 53.46 seconds to edge out Voelker (53.50).
Le, who completed golden doubles in the 50 and 100 freestyle at the last two world short-course championships, had to settle for bronze in 53.72.

Le, double world champion and Olympic 100 freestyle gold medallist, said in a recent interview she was treating these championships as a warm-up for the Chinese National Games in Shanghai next October.
